Description: Ostracon (?), large section of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is partially grey in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394861) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394861)
